title: Designing MOOC-Based Language Learning Accessibility and Micro-Credential Pathways

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital literacy and online learning experience, foundational grammar comprehension, and reading skills
context.additional_context: Designing MOOC-based strategies for office/administrative professionals to acquire alternative language certifications. Focuses on enhancing reading/writing skills and expressive abilities required in workplace contexts.

learning_goals: Learners select at least three language learning courses from MOOC platforms like Coursera and edX, establish a weekly learning plan (including time, goals, vocabulary/grammar evaluation criteria), implement it for eight weeks with over 80% adherence, and write a 2,000-character self-assessment report reflecting their learning outcomes.

Learners select three or more language-related micro-credentials (e.g., digital badges, online certification programs), analyze each credential’s components (learning content, assessment methods, issuing institution credibility), and design a customized certification pathway aligned with their learning needs. The designed pathway must achieve an "Excellent" rating in at least two of the three expert feedback rubric criteria: clarity, feasibility, and innovativeness. It must specifically include elements that enhance linguistic expression and reading comprehension skills.

Through a project-based assessment (6-month course), learners design one or more language education contents applicable to real-world work environments (e.g., corporate training, online lecture platforms) and submit a final output that meets at least four of the five expert evaluation rubric criteria (e.g., practicality, creativity, educational effectiveness, text utilization, communication strategy).
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
